title: Orchestrating Intelligence: The New Senior Engineer
excerpt: The definition of 'Senior Engineer' just changed. Move from optimizing typing speed to optimizing orchestration and governing agents.
content:
Stop optimizing your typing speed. Start optimizing your orchestration. The definition of “Senior Engineer” just changed.

In 2024, we optimized for velocity — how fast could we ship?
In 2026, we optimize for reliability — how well can we govern an agent?

Here’s the uncomfortable truth: Studies show devs using AI for complex tasks can be ~19% slower. Why? Because we’re stuck reviewing “almost right” code.

The bottleneck isn’t syntax anymore. It’s decision-making.

The Shift to Agentic Workflows

The highest-paid engineers I know aren’t writing the cleanest loops. They’re building agentic workflows.

Using tools like MCP and LangGraph, they turn LLMs into:

  • Traceable systems
  • Deterministic pipelines
  • Reliable production workflows

You’re not just a coder now. You’re an architect of probability. From writing code → to orchestrating intelligence.

"Those who learn to govern agents will lead the next decade of software. The rest will keep reviewing diffs of 'almost right'."

Question: Are you spending more time coding — or reviewing AI output — this week?
